column4: i can't open synaptic says dpkg interrupted you must manually run 'dpkg --configure -a'
but i run that and it doesn't work??
it is doing something with db-common for another program i haven't touched in synatpic in forever..
slart: i typed that command yeah
and you got some kind of error? tried putting a sudo in front of it?
it says db-common flushing administrator password for a program i haven't even worked with forever
well... I guess you'll have to check the manual for this mysterious program
it's cacti a lot of people use it
it's been running forever, and still is
then when i went to install something else through synaptic there is a problem
you could always try uninstalling cacti
slart: i could would not be good though, there is a big configuration file and rrd databases
slart: i can't tell it to ignore cacti
why is it even messing with that
it might have been some kind of update.. not sure if you can just tell it to ignore one package.. Apt is a big program full of features, wouldn't surprise me if there was a way
